pageContext.claim: “He's already at a high level and he's already passed Senate confirmation, et cetera, et cetera, on other things.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's new national security adviser, Robert C. O'Brien, was confirmed by the Senate in 2006, 13 years ago, for the post of alternate representative to the U.N. General Assembly. His position in the Trump administration, special envoy for hostage negotiations, did not require Senate confirmation.
